intro: Gonianthes pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a small flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its foliage is heart-shaped and has a slightly hairy texture.
